text: is this a correct behavior? for instance you create a structure A, why `methodswith(A)` does not print anything because it’s a type? i have to use `methodswith(typeof(A))` for it to list functions operating on it, even if you pass `supertypes=true` , this does not print methods in its supertypes?

text:
```abstract type Foo end
struct Bar <: Foo end
foo(x::Foo) = true
methodswith(Bar, supertypes=true)```
Works as expected for me. What are you seeing?

elements.text:

struct Bar <: Foo end
foo(x::Foo) = true
methodswith(Bar, supertypes=true)
